reviews.text: The Clay hotel is nothing special room wise but was in a fantastic location right next to the beach. It was also close to lincoln rd which was a good place to shop and eat. The room was clean, it had a tv and fringe but was basic. For value for money fine. If you are a traveller i would stay here. If you like your creature comforts maybe not. I was packbacking when i stayed and it did the job well. Night life was busy so u might need ear plugs. All in all not bad.
reviews.title: Loved the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay at the Clay Hotel twice in two weeks. Both of times we booked a standard room, but the second time we were upgraded to the VIP room since the air conditioning in our standard room was really loud.
reviews.title: A nice place!

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great position: in the middle of the spanish area ( Espanola way), two blocks from Ocean Drive and 5 minutes from Lincoln Road. The standard room was small but clean, even if different from what showed in their website. The bathroom was kind of old but ok. The VIP room ( in our pics) was great, but I guess was the best available since it looks like it was the one with a big balcony. In general a nice place to stay given the position. the staff was really helpfull, we also got a car space in a nearby park for 10 extra dollars a day.
reviews.title: fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Clay is what it is - a simple, very basic room with a great location and dirt cheap price tag for SoBe. I had a pleasant stay. Staff very helpful and accommodating. The rooms are a bit worn, but the bathroom was very clean, plenty of towels (the only other supplies are toilet paper and hand soap) - hairdryers and irons available at the front desk. I stayed in the main building on Washington and Espanola - changed my room to the main building after being put in a "renovated" room at the end of street. I prefered the main building with the front desk. . I had a room with 2 twin beds, cable tv, good A/C, refrigerator - excellent treat to have cold drinks in your room. A lot of friendly, pleasant international hotel guests, quiet at night. I prefer the Clay to most of the "popular" deco hotels - too noisy and congested on Ocean Drive. The Clay is a bargain. Kafka internet cafe around the corner on Washington Street. San Loco and La Sandwicherie on 13th for cheap eats, one block south. Lincoln road close by for nice shops, movie theater and cafes.
reviews.title: A European Vacation on South Beach

reviews.text: I live in Miami, visit the beach a couple of times a month and often stay on the beach over long weekends. I wanted to try something different so I stayed at The Clay Hotel over the Columbus Day Weekend. I was a little apprehensive because of the many poor reviews on this site.
reviews.title: great location in south beach

reviews.text: First of all, this hotel probably has the BEST location of budget hotels in Miami. Of course, not on Ocean Drive, where you pay rates starting at 299 per night, but on the very nice pedestrian Esplanada Way, just a few yards from Ocean Drive
reviews.title: Primelocation - OK budget rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here because it was centrally located and it was very affordable compared to other hotels and hostels in South Beach. The location is definitely great, with lots of great restaurants/bars in the main floor of the hotel and on the pedestrian street it is located on.
reviews.title: A reasonable alternative

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived, we very much needed some sleep after a long flight/day, but when we set our things down in the room and turned on the A/C, it did not provide any cool air. We went down to the lobby and they sent a handyman to fix the A/C. After about an hour once it was supposedly "fixed," it would not turn on. They moved us to another room where the A/C did work, but which was a cheaper room with bunk beds instead of 1 queen bed (for which we were not reimbursed, as we still paid the more expensive room's rate). The A/C worked in the second room, albeit not very well...definitely not pleasant in the heat of Miami in May.
reviews.title: Nice location but disappointing rooms

reviews.text: I really liked this hotel. I have stayed in luxury resorts and this is not. I have stayed in hostels abroad and this is not but maybe closer to budget hotel. No elevator. Very comfortable feel. It was very clean. We stayed in a suite in the back. Room 15. It was perfect. Two double beds, AC and ceiling fans, mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, flat screen TVs. Walking distance to everywhere. Near to the beach and all the cool restaurants and Lincoln Mall Road. We loved it! Price was perfect. Left the car in parking garage. No need for it. Will be back again.
reviews.title: Española Way is a fabulous location!

In the end, it was quite funny and we soon caught up as it wasn't anywhere as near as loud on the following nights.

reviews.text: This is a very nice budget accommodation. Our room, though small, was recently renovated. Hotel is right on Espanola Way, with great shops and restaurants. Just a few blocks from the beach and Lincoln Road. There is no pool or elevator in case these things are important to you.
reviews.title: Great location
Great when it was dirt cheap; a rip-off now.
reviews.text: I stayed at the Clay Hotel several years ago. When it was $70/night (including taxes), it was absolutely worth it. The rooms were a bit weathered, the furniture not very appealing, and the service nearly non-existent. But so what? As it was reasonably clean and convenient, it was a no-brainer at that price.

reviews.title: Very cheap, and the description says it all......
reviews.text: All of that has changed in light of the new prices. The photos of the hotel show no particular change inside, and there are no claims that it's now a boutique hotel; but the prices have more than doubled. It's an outrage. And, judging from the recent reviews, people are unimpressed with the quality. (I'll bet they'd complain less if they had paid only $60/night.)

reviews.title: TERRIBLE HOTEL!! THIS PLACE IS A TOTAL DUMP!!
reviews.text: This hotel is no longer competitive in the Miami Beach area. If you want to spend $120-160, you can do far, far better.

reviews.title: Think about it...

reviews.title: Shocking!!!!
reviews.text: Had a very poor experience. First off, in the description of the room I had booked.........not what I got. I ended up sharing with another 4 girls that was between one tiny kitchen. The walls were paper thin....you could hear the noise outside; the beds weren't comfortable at all, and it was dirty as well. I don' t recommend staying at this place; although for the price, it's great, but still. You can get the same price, but get a bigger and cleaner room up one block.

We live an hour north in Palm Beach and found this hotel to be exactly what we wanted. Meeting some friends we picked up at the airport and they wanted to see South Beach for a night. We had a great time in South Beach for an evening. This hotel is in a perfect location to everything. A lot of restaurants and bars all within walking distance. We drove and used their valet service for $20.00 a night. Our car was parked on the street directly across from the hotel. :). Everything you need is within a 15 minute walk. Friendly hotel staff and charming rooms. Clean and efficient. They have a restaurant and bar directly downstairs as part of the hotel. But the street it is on offers so many that it was hard to choose. The beach is minutes away within walking distance. Shopping is also right there. There is a nice little market across the street for coffee and local favorites to take out and stroll with. Not a boutique hotel by any means, but clean and perfect for a night or 2 stay without gauging your budget.
reviews.title: Wonderful location.

reviews.text: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Found hairs in bed. No lift for luggage. Door from street to corridor was never locked. Every night I turned the light on little cockroaches would scurry around. Also on what seems to be the loudest street in Miami. Music blaring till 3am on Thursday night and around 5am Friday night. The only positive is the location.
reviews.title: Don't even think about it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed at! After taking a look at our allocated room we quickly returned to reception to complain. We were then shown a further five rooms each of which were sub standard, all extremely filthy & in bad repair with serious security issues (no/broken air con, safe and one room didn't even have a door lock!) We booked a 'luxury' room and although we were fully aware that this is a basic hotel, there is no way anybody can justify charging in excess of £80 per night for this total dump! Almost forgot, for your £80 you do also get a pair of dirty knickers wrapped in your bath towel - lovely!!
reviews.title: The worst hotel ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are intending on staying in South Beach then stay at this hotel. The location is perfect! The hotel itself is not flash by any means but its clean, safe and good value. The area is vibrant and energetic and is very close to the beach and Ocean drive. Theres a club accross the road thats good but hard to get into. The only irish pub we could find in Miami was only a ten minute walk. The staff are helpful and efficient. The parking is a bit awkard at first as its about a block away but after the first time you find it and put in the car its good. We stayed here for a week and then moved onto Key West then up to Orlando and then New York for a few days but staying at the clay and being in that part of South Beach was the best! Dont see how it can get bad reviews, it may be better suited to young people looking for good value and good atmosphere!
reviews.title: The Clay for South Beach!

OK for South Beach
reviews.text: My room was a deluxe room with 2 beds, one private bathroom, a safe, a tv, a fridge and aircon. I stayed 8 nights from 25 december to 2 jan. For sure, it's not the cleanest hotel, but tovels were changed every day. The location is quite noisy because espanola way but it's not an issue for young people from my point of view. The geographical situation is great. Lincoln road for shopping is just a walk away like top clubs (Cameo, Mansion,...) and beach (Lummus Park). The Clay is a good choice if you get a deluxe room. Check discount rate on internet
